intro: Gilia candida subsp. vera, commonly known as the white gilia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Mexico. It belongs to the tribe Phyllantheae within the family Polemoniaceae, and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils, and it is often found in disturbed areas. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Gilia candida subsp. vera is a herbaceous perennial that blooms from late spring to early summer.
